vulnerabilities.cve-description: The cfe module sb v1.0.1 (artificially modified for the EBOSS program) contains the vulnerable code weakness CWE-590 which frees memory that is not on the heap. In this artificially modified version of the library, the command CFE_SB_SUBSCRIBE_LOCAL is not supported and the code has been modified to reflect that. In the case this module receives a CFE_SB_SUBSCRIBE_LOCAL command, the return code is set to be an error case and the pointer to the message, which is stack memory, is freed.
vulnerabilities.cwe-name: Free of Memory not on the Heap

vulnerabilities.cve-description: The debug-app v1.0.1 (artificially created and modified for the EBOSS program) contains the vulnerable code weakness CWE-476 where a NULL pointer is dereferenced. This application is meant for developers to test basic functionalities in the cFS ecosystem. A debug function DEBUG_APP_CRASH was left in the code and therefore, if this command is sent, a NULL pointer is dereferenced and the cFS system crashes.
